page.title: 08A/FORCES.CLUBS.ATTITUDES.ART
page.content: No military installations in the area but some service personnel (Naval and R.M.) and Dockyard workers commute to Plymouth. Area forms part of a low flying range for the Royal Air Force. There are no clubs within the area, but people belong to clubs that meet nearby, W.I.,Women's Guild,Lions,Young Farmers,Youth Clubs,Round Table,Rotary Scouts,Guides. Local pubs run darts, pool and snooker clubs. Attitudes are conservative (not polit- ical sense).Farmers have consideration for wildlife and the environment, and most of the land is well maintained. Most people,though recognising the need, resent the power of Planning Authority. Leisure activities include painting, woodwork,model engineering, and arts and crafts in many forms.
